com.eis.greenenergy.main

Class MainActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • com.eis.greenenergy.main.MainActivity

  • public class MainActivity
extends Activity
    Class to display and control the main view of the application.
    This activity displays the user's data along with the ImageButton for sending Tweets. It also shows the current amount of green energy, a related pie chart, and a thumb icon as recommendation. Moreover this view includes predictions concerning energy data in 1, 3, and 5 hours. A button enables the forwarding to the detail view by sending an intent to DetailActivity.
    Furthermore the activity redirects the user to LoginActivity, if the user's login-data is not stored on the internal device storage.
    Since:
    2014-05-30
    Version:
    2.1
    Author:
    Veronika Henk, Sarvenaz Golchin, Mahnaz Hajibaba

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainActivity

        public MainActivity()

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Initiates the activity layout, checks for a network connection, and initiates UserManager object.
        In detail, the corresponding layout file is assigned in this method. Moreover this method checks if the device has access to a network connection by creating an instance of the auxiliary class AlertDialogManager.
        By creating an instance of the class UserManager this method tries to access the user's data. If this is completed successfully, the method initGUI which builds the actual layout is called; otherwise it redirects to LoginActivity and this activity itself is finished.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - Saved information about each View object in this activity's layout, to enable restoring this state if the activity instance is destroyed and recreated.

      • onResume

        protected void onResume()
        Calls the method to initiate the activity layout if the user is logged in, or finishes this activity otherwise.
        Moreover, this method creates a new instance of UserManager when the activity is restored and checks if the user is logged in. If the user is logged in, the user data is displayed along with the activity's layout. Otherwise LoginActivity is called and this instance of the MainActivity is terminated.

      • initGUI

        private void initGUI()
        Sets the actual layout for this activity.
        First, an instance of SharedPreferences is initialized. Next, the current point in time is requested and the individual layout elements are initialized and text is assigned to the textviews. Therefore, the current amount of green energy and predictions for in 1, 3, and 5 hours are retrieved, calling the method accessdata() for the instance of UserManager with the current point in time as parameter. The predictions are assigned to the according textviews in order to display them on the screen.
        Based on the current percentage of green energy, the corresponding chart is selected and displayed on the center of the screen.
        Also, the more detail and the Twitter button are implemented by setting up their onClick() methods.

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)
        Initiates the menu initialization when an instance of the activity is created.
        Moreover the menu is inflated when this method is called and the items defined in this method are added. So far we only have one item, which is the logout function.
        Parameters:
        menu - The menu of this activity.
        Returns:
        true if the menu was inflated successfully;
        false otherwise.

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        Defines the actions to be done when an item in the menu is selected.
        So far we only have one menu entry, which has the purpose to trigger the user's logout. Therefore if this item is selected, the method logout() which is also defined in this activity, is called.
        Parameters:
        item - Menu entry which was selected.
        Returns:
        true if the selected item was identified successfully and according actions could be initiated;
        false otherwise.

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Conducts the user's logout from the application as well as from Twitter.
        Moreover to log the user out from the application, the login-data is deleted from his device. To log out from Twitter the instance of SharedPreferences is edited and the Twitter Api keys are removed from it. This activity automatically forwards to LoginActivity. As the user is not supposed to see this view, when he is not logged in, this activity is then finished.
